data.title: Pathfinding disregards shroud
data.body:
In the original series, if you ever command your units to go anywhere in an unrevealed map/terrain, the units would straight walk in (as if, shortest path, and nothing would be standing in their way). Only when new terrain is revealed and their path seems to be blocked the path finding kicks in (a new path is calculated to 'get around the obstacle'. 

In short: Path finding assumes shrouded areas are always passable.

In openRA i noticed my units already took the best path possible, even though they had never seen the terrain. This kind of makes the path finding very smart, but I also consider this a bit of cheating. 

Revealing shroud would really have an extra effect if you take the shrouded data into consideration when calculating the best path to reach a destination.
## <bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Crash when trying save a map in the editor after manually editing the map.yaml
data.body:
On bleed

I am trying to reduce the size of some maps due to the boundaries being in weird places. I manually edit the boundaries to nearly match the overall map size, then use the copy paste tool to move the entire map to the correct position. The game then throws an exception when I try and save.

http://pastebin.com/znKCYkBf

The error happens in `SaveMapLogic.cs` line `141`

```
var combinedPath = Platform.ResolvePath(Path.Combine(directoryDropdown.Text, filename.Text + fileTypes[typeDropdown.Text]));
```

http://i.imgur.com/SGrmTWo.png

data.title: power interfaces
data.body:
Asking for help with this.

Trying to implement INotifyPower Interfaces for use with the GPS power. Wondering if I am remotely on the right track.

Currently these only trigger on ATEK construction. I can use `self.Owner.PlayerActor.Trait<PowerManager>();` to decide what power lever the player has but I don't know where I should put this logic (I assume Power.cs)

What is the correct approach to trigger these on power change?

data.title: GPS updates frozen actors that change owner
data.body:
There are two main changes in this PR:
- A new trait, `FrozenUnderFogUpdatedByGps`, replaces `GpsRemoveFrozenActor`. It supports removing frozen actors that are sold or die but also now supports refreshing the frozen actor when ownership changes. This brings it in line with the GPS dot which changes colour as required.
- Remove the `IRemoveFrozenActor` interface. This caused `FrozenActorLayer.Tick` to be quite slow. The new trait only needs to run when the GPS state changes, rather than every tick. This is faster.

I would test the following:
- When a GPS is launched, that frozen actors are updated as follows:
  - A frozen actor for a sold building is removed.
  - A frozen actor for a destroyed building is removed.
  - A frozen actor for a building that was captured is updated with new colours.
- With an active GPS, check that frozen actors are updated live for the above three scenarios.

---

On the RA shellmap, reduces CPU time spent in `FrozenActorLayer.Tick` from 1.39% to 0.83%.

Suggested changelog: GPS updates frozen actors that change owner

data.title: Ensure some structs implement IEquatable<T>.
data.body:
I have moved around some of the code to make it consistent with existing overrides in other vectors such as `CPos`, `WVec`, etc.

Implementating `IEquatable<T>` is important for structs as this is used as the default equality comparer (when available) for inbuilt collections that need a definition of equality (like `Dictionary`). Implementing it allows them to avoid boxing costs if such a struct is the key.

data.title: Store triggers in ScriptTriggers in an array.
data.body:
We can use the enum to index the array directly, in order to give faster lookups compared to a dictionary.

Provides a modest speedup to `ScriptTriggers.TickIdle` on the RA shellmap, reducing CPU time from 0.41% to 0.34%.

data.title: "Guard" command (D) does not work anymore
data.body:
Since playtest-20151213, I have come to notice that the guard command [standard: "D"] does not work anymore.

The mouse cursor changes, albeit it can't be executed [nothing hapens after clicking an allied unit/structure].

[IRC]
[12:14] jaZz_KCS    I noticed the "defend" command not executing since the last playtest also in the release, has something changed?
[12:15] jaZz_KCS    the animation shows on mouse albeit the command cant be given
[12:15] pchote  guard?
[12:15] jaZz_KCS    yeh
[12:15] jaZz_KCS    just not working throughout all mods
[12:15] pchote  left clickimg?
[12:15] jaZz_KCS    yes with left click orders aka classic
[12:16] pchote  what about amove?
[12:16] jaZz_KCS    amove works, only guard doesnt
[12:16] jaZz_KCS    since pt-20151213
[12:16] pchote  lame
[12:17] pchote  that will be a regression from joystick scroll
[12:17] pchote  file a bug please
[/IRC]

data.title: Add competitive maps to the pool
data.body:
Adds the following maps into the map pool. Some of these maps are in the latest release but not on bleed.

Tabula rasa
http://resource.openra.net/maps/8174/

Tabula rasa has had a slight balance adjustment; The ridge and oil derricks on the top left have been moved right a few cells to allow base building similar to the bottom right. Various tiles fixed and some more decoration added to some bare areas.

Sidestep
http://resource.openra.net/maps/8176/

Behind The Veil (which I missed last time)
http://resource.openra.net/maps/8178/

All maps parsed on bleed

data.title: Map Upgrade Utility in release changes hash probably when map does not require upgrade
data.body:
maybe bug maybe not; I file it so it can be checked;

case: 1 map parsed by release, Lint succeeds; same map upgraded to release results in different hash.
example: http://resource.openra.net/maps/4711
this is map included in release distribution; automated upgrade from release-20150919
 to release-20151224 already created new revision of it as hash after running map-upgrade changed

That's the same for many maps.
Noticed while manually uploading fresh distributed maps to Resource Center.

Thanks for the great re-implementation!

data.title: Terrain overlay is broken
data.body:
The terrain overlay in bleed is broken in funny ways.

git bisect says af344452eaa936187c453510037b3202dafbe0a4 is the first bad commit.

```
commit af344452eaa936187c453510037b3202dafbe0a4
Author: Paul Chote <pchote@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Sat Dec 19 22:06:55 2015 +0000

    Convert RgbaColorRenderer to TriangleList.
```

![screenshot from 2015-12-28 15 00 17](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4331210/12020300/126c100c-ad7b-11e5-9f3b-c7500022e9bd.png)
